content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty hey guys i DM Scotty here good to have you
with me today scrap we're going to do a torch holder and this was just a simple
craft but it's really effective the basis of the craft are beads that I buy
at the craft store I always like to find interesting beads and make them in this
stuff so I kind of have a bin of beads that I save and you know make stuff out
of it so this is just a quick easy little craft to make out of some of
those beads so let's go the table I'll show you what I got here are all the
objects are used for the project and you can see I've got two washers ones a half
inch ones three quarters of an inch I use two beads from some beads I got at
the craft store and you can see I have a q-tip which is actually my wife gave me
this it's actually one that shaped on the end I really like that that's a
great way to start so really I just have to shape the top of it when I do the
torch technique here we have the torch stand all
assembled and all I did was I just took the smaller washer put it on top of the
bigger one I glued it with this glue called goop which is my favorite glue
for this type of thing then I put the other bead on top glued that one on top
glue the second bead on top of that one and then I stuck the the the q-tip
through the center there and I haven't shaped it yet you can see it's still
just the shape the standard shape of the q-tip
although I like this one because it's like a it's like a teardrop shape but I
need to do the I need to wet it and then shape it with the white glue so there we
go so that's the assembled stand and I will paint those up and we'll go to the
table and show you what they look like so hey guys here's our finished product
on the tile I think it really looks nice so they're just simple easy and quick
give you a little close look at that now what I did is I just painted it black
spray painted black then painted it with the gunmetal to gunmetal paint and it
gave a nice old weathered look now for the flame I just painted it with the
flame technique okay now I didn't just leave these in the shape that they were
when I put him in these holders I actually wet the flame and then pulled
it up and then used some white glue to keep those in place so I did each flame
a different shape and that also hardens up the flame keeps him solid so you want
a problem during play but yeah those are some nice little stands they also the
washers on the bottom also give them weight so that's really nice too and
they want to you know slide around and stuff on your tile so there you go
there's some nice torch holders and I'll see you next time on the craft hey
crafters I hope you've enjoyed this episode of the DMS craft make sure to
subscribe and I have tons of other videos as you can see I am the
originator of the 2.5 D method of crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap
terrain for the table if all this intrigues you make sure you check out
all the videos below also join my forum we have lots of great crafters on there
who give advice I have a link above and below and last but not least remember go
forth and craft you
